intro: Cylicadenia, commonly known as the false nettle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Violaceae. These plants are characterized by their opposite, ovate leaves and clusters of small, white or violet flowers. They typically grow in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Cylicadenia species are often found in temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous tiny seeds.
